post_text:
Affinity credit card scheme[Finance]

Affinity_credit_card_scheme


An affinity credit card scheme is a group scheme where a designated organisation is payed a small percentage of all transactions of the cards from the lending association. Examples include the DCU and Trinity College affinity schemes. These schemes can raise a lot of money for an organisation in the short to medium term. The DCU example above has reputedly raised ?32,000 in its first year of operation from just 600 applicants drawn from it's alumni membership.

Finance　Renewal 2005.10.29
